Added test for logging playback.

Test compares between double pendulum link poses in current physics simulation and link poses in recorded log file, at the closest timestamp to current sim time.

update.description:
Added test for logging playback.

Test compares between double pendulum link poses in current physics simulation and link poses in recorded log file, at the closest timestamp to current sim time.
update.title: [Acropolis] Test for logging playback

content.raw:
I think that if we want to use the time API from the logging system (as opposed to checking the message header), we'll need to use a sim time clock as I started [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/branches/compare/log_serialized%0Ddefault#Lsrc/systems/log/LogRecord.ccT222).

I'm not convinced we should use that as the primary time though. It stamps messages with the latest time received on the `/clock` topic, and we can't guarantee that this is received in a synchronized manner. On the other hand, the stamps within the messages have the precise sim time in them.

To sum up, I think we should use the clock for convenience, but don't rely on it for things requiring precision, such as playback.
content.html:
I think that if we want to use the time API from the logging system (as opposed to checking the message header), we'll need to use a sim time clock as I started here.

I'm not convinced we should use that as the primary time though. It stamps messages with the latest time received on the /clock topic, and we can't guarantee that this is received in a synchronized manner. On the other hand, the stamps within the messages have the precise sim time in them.

To sum up, I think we should use the clock for convenience, but don't rely on it for things requiring precision, such as playback.

content.raw: One solution would be to just include this as part of the test above. Another way would be to save pre-recorded test files to a `/test/media` folder (which is also good if we ever need a reference log file known to work), I started adding some in  4e3011f
content.html: One solution would be to just include this as part of the test above. Another way would be to save pre-recorded test files to a /test/media folder (which is also good if we ever need a reference log file known to work), I started adding some in 4e3011f

content.raw: We shouldn't count on the tests running in a row, it should be possible to run this test case by itself (i.e. `INTEGRATION_log_system --gtest_filter="*PosePlay*"`)
content.html: We shouldn't count on the tests running in a row, it should be possible to run this test case by itself (i.e. INTEGRATION_log_system --gtest_filter="*PosePlay*")

content.raw:
Fixed in de20275

I realized that `CreateCacheDir()` is only called in one place so maybe it doesn’t need to be refactored now. But there are some private functions in the LogRecord plugin that aren’t covered, e.g. unique file path, unique directory path, and more tests may be added in the future.
content.html:
Fixed in de20275

I realized that CreateCacheDir() is only called in one place so maybe it doesn’t need to be refactored now. But there are some private functions in the LogRecord plugin that aren’t covered, e.g. unique file path, unique directory path, and more tests may be added in the future.
